meanings.definition: A small amphibian with a long slender body and tail.
meanings.sent1: In the pond, the newts swam gracefully among the lily pads.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of newts near the creek during my nature walk.
meanings.sent3: The newts had a meeting to discuss the upcoming tadpole race.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were as sleek and agile as a newt gliding through water.
meanings.sent5: The newts' vibrant colors made them stand out in the murky pond.

meanings.definition: To behave in a timid or cowardly manner.
meanings.sent1: During the presentation, he newts and avoided eye contact with the audience.
meanings.sent2: She newts whenever she has to confront her fear of heights.
meanings.sent3: The cat newted around the vacuum cleaner, afraid of its loud noise.
meanings.sent4: He newted away from the bully, trying to avoid any confrontation.
meanings.sent5: The newting squirrel hesitated before crossing the busy street.
